title: Lisa Armstrong bans Strictly stars from using fake tan for Halloween night
text:

Strictly’s head make-up artist Lisa Armstrong has banned fake tan on the show for this weekend’s Halloween special.

The ex-wife of Ant McPartlin, who has been doing the hit BBC1 Saturday night show for 13 years, said Strictly’s famous Halloween show was the most stressful and most daunting of the series.

Lisa, 43, said in an interview: “I’m only just getting over Movie Week! But despite the stress we always manage to pull it off.

“In Halloween week it’s non-stop chaos from the moment we walk through the door at 8am on Saturday until we finish the results show.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

“Normally the boys take 20 minutes for a bit of powder to cover up shaving rashes but for Halloween they all have full-on make-up so everyone has an hour in the chair - and it’s more for the girls.”

Lisa says the infamous Strictly fake tan isn’t allowed this weekend either.

“I ban it for Halloween because I don’t want orange zombies” she told Weekend magazine .

“They’re all paler so there’s a tan ban!”
